content.description: Starts on a left crimp and a right sidepull in a groove. Paste your right foot in the bottom of the groove and make a hard slap up to some slopers in a flared horizontal. Match and set your feet and make another hard punch to a sloping edge up and right at the lip. Top out with either the mantle (harder) or the corner(easier).
content.location: Sit down start at reall the only place you can below the steep south face of the boulder.

content.description:
Work you hands up into seams above the lip then throw a high foot and rock on. Getting the foot up and pressing it out are the hardest part. Don't botther looking for anything above the seams because there is nothing up there. 

Some what of an eliminate since the corner to the right is OFF but all in all a great mantle challenge.
content.location: On the left side of the steep south face off the boulder there is a clean slab above the lip of the overhand with a corner to the right. Use pads or jump up to the lip and mantle without the corner.

content.description: From slopers below the corner climb up using the seam in the corner and an edge up to the right of the arete. Again the hard bit involves moving up onto feet over the lip but is easier because of the high edge out right.
content.location: The obvious left facing corner that starts above the lip of the overhang on the south face of the boulder. High start may require stacking pads, jumping or a boost to slopers at the lip.

content.description:
Large boulder with several problems on it. Steep south face, mainly blank west face, south east face is shaded by a tree and has a rock sitting behind it. The rock quality on this boulder is quite good and the problems are mostly difficult V4 and up. 

  To descend, follow the cut off pipes that are rustling to a step across to the rock that sits behind the south east face.
